title: Lapham Peak Fright Hike, Kohler Food & Wine Experience, Pumpkin Chuckin Fest
text:
Lapham Peak Fright Hike, Kohler Food & Wine Experience, Pumpkin Chuckin Fest Kohler Food & Wine Experience “Top Chef” contestant Fabio Viviani appeared at the Kohler Food & Wine Experience in 2013. By Chelsey Lewis of the Journal Sentinel Oct. 18, 2015 6:00 a.m. (0) Comments 
Delafield: Fright Hike. Take a spooky walk along a 2-mile trail at Lapham Peak, W329 N846 Highway C, from 6 to 8:45 p.m. Friday and Saturday. Haunted scenes will dot the trail, and visitors can vote for their favorites and warm up around a bonfire after. Admission is $5 for those ages 6 and up; park admission is $5 per vehicle (or a state park admission sticker). See frighthike.com . 
Kohler: Food & Wine Experience. Indulge in culinary delights at this event Thursday through next Sunday. Events include seminars, demonstrations and tastings with celebrity chefs, wine experts and libation specialists. Prices vary by event, and various locations around the resort will also host complimentary demonstrations and tastings. See kohlerfoodandwine.com . 
Cambridge: Earth, Wood & Fire Artist Tour. Travel through the colorful fall landscape of southern Wisconsin in search of artists' studios from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Saturday and next Sunday. Studios from Cambridge, Jefferson, Johnson Creek and Lake Mills will open their doors to visitors. See earthwoodandfiretour.com . 
Madison: Wisconsin Book Festival. The written word takes center stage in Madison during this festival Thursday through next Sunday. More than 70 events are scheduled, with something for every reader, including appearances by award-winning authors such as Adam Johnson, Timothy Egan and Wisconsin Poet Laureate Kim Blaeser. Events take place around the city. See wisconsinbookfestival.org . 
Union Grove: Great Pumpkin Chuckin Fest. Squash will be soaring in Union Grove Saturday and next Sunday during this festival. In addition to the pumpkin chucking competition Saturday, there will be a barbecue cookoff, kids activities, carnival rides, live music and a parade. The festival takes place from 10 a.m. to 10 p.m. Saturday and 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. next Sunday. See uniongrovechamber.org . 
Wisconsin Dells: 150 Years of the H.H. Bennett Studio. It's the last week to see this exhibit celebrating the 150th anniversary of the H.H. Bennett Studio, 215 Broadway. The exhibit includes images and artifacts from the photographer who put Wisconsin Dells on the map, including some never seen before. Tours are $7 for adults, $6 for students and senior citizens, $3.50 for children ages 5 to 17 and $19 for a family. See hhbennettstudio.wisconsinhistory.org . 
Illinois: Halloween Gathering. This is the first year for this Halloween festival in Chicago, scheduled for Saturday in and around Millennium Park. From 2 to 5 p.m. visitors can attend the art and Halloween festival, which will include crafts, performances, interactive experiences and a children's costume parade. At 6 p.m., it's the adults' turn to march, with a parade set to travel north on Columbus from Balbo to Monroe. See chicagoculturalmile.org . 
Minnesota: Pumpkin Festival. Bring the kids to this free event from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. Saturday in Edina's 50th & France neighborhood. There will be trick-or-treating, a costume contest, face painting, a magician, pumpkin carving and horse-drawn trolley rides. See 50thandfrance.com . 
— Chelsey Lewis 
Please send notice of events three weeks in advance to: All Over the Map, Travel Section, P.O. Box 371, Milwaukee, WI 53201 or to jsfeat@journalsentinel.com, with All Over the Map as the subject. © 2015 , Journal Sentinel Inc. All rights reserved. About Chelsey Lewis 
Chelsey Lewis writes about travel and things to do in Wisconsin for Wisconsin Trails and the Journal Sentinel.
